history.content:
(a) If you haven't declared yet, and you've taken EE16A, you don't need to take 54 if you intend on taking 16B (and, as per Professor Sahai, that is the recommended path). 

(b) I would suggest either 16B or 61C (but not both together) alongside CS70, and one of the other courses you mentioned (haven't heard much about BioE 11, CogSci 1 or Linguistics 100); 16B + 61C + CS70 would be pretty brutal, so choose two of the three and take a lighter technical to accompany them (maybe CS188, if you're strong with probability?)

OP here. Thanks for your response, but will 188 and 70 nicely complement each other? Also, does anyone know if I have to take 54 if I want to major in Stats? I have credit for 53 already and don't think the 16 series will transfer.

I didn't take them together, but based off my current experiences in 188, it does seem like they would be a decent complement (although getting into CS188 next semester might be very difficult as an undeclared major). 

As for transferring credit, I believe Prof Sahai is the best person to talk to about transferring credit over from the 16 series for Math 54.

(a) If you haven't declared yet, and you've taken EE16A, you don't need to take 54 if you intend on taking 16B (and, as per Professor Sahai, that is the recommended path). 

(b) I would suggest either 16B or 61C (but not both together) alongside CS70, and one of the other courses you mentioned (haven't heard much about BioE 11, CogSci 1 or Linguistics 100); 16B + 61C + CS70 would be pretty brutal, so choose two of the three and take a lighter technical to accompany them (maybe CS188, if you're strong with probability?)

OP here. Thanks for your response, but will 188 and 70 nicely complement each other? Also, does anyone know if I have to take 54 if I want to major in Stats? I have credit for 53 already and don't think the 16 series will transfer.

(a) If you haven't declared yet, and you've taken EE16A, you don't need to take 54 if you intend on taking 16B (and, as per Professor Sahai, that is the recommended path). 

(b) I would suggest either 16B or 61C (but not both together) alongside CS70, and one of the other courses you mentioned (haven't heard much about BioE 11, CogSci 1 or Linguistics 100); 16B + 61C + CS70 would be pretty brutal, so choose two of the three and take a lighter technical to accompany them (maybe CS188, if you're strong with probability?)

children.subject: Linguistics 100 is a great class, and it's not that hard and would go well as a breadth with other technicals (I had a light semester when I took it though so hard to say what it would be like with harder classes -- I took it with 61A, Math 54, and a seminar. However I did take Linguistics 110 with 61B and 70, which at times could get pretty intense but 110 is quite a bit harder than 100)

history.content: I'm intended L&S CS, considering EE16B, CS61C, Math 54 (would rather avoid because I took Differential Equations at a community college and EE16A), and Stat 134 (might want to wait for 140 in Spring). I'd also like to do BioE 11, CogSci 1, or Linguistics 100
history.subject: Classes to take with 70 Next Semester
